main event: An airman at Keesler Air Force Base observed a bright, round object in the sky on March 7, 1954, moving at high speed and changing direction abruptly.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be approximately 500 feet in altitude and traveling at a speed of approximately 500 mph.
It was visible for approximately 10-15 seconds before disappearing from view.
The object did not make any sound and appeared to be self-luminous.
A thorough investigation was conducted, including a search for physical evidence, but no evidence was recovered.
No other witnesses were found to corroborate the airman's account.
sighted object: bright, round object in the sky
